context_bundle.summary: Microservice architecture pattern: Decompose monolith into small, independent services. Each service: single responsibility, own database, REST/gRPC APIs, deployed independently. Patterns: API Gateway (entry point), Service Discovery (Consul, Eureka), Circuit Breaker (Hystrix, resilience4j), Saga (distributed transactions). Communication: sync (HTTP/gRPC) or async (Kafka, RabbitMQ). Benefits: independent deploy, tech diversity, scalability. Challenges: complexity, distributed data, network latency.

onboarding.quick_start: Microservices: Break app into services (user-service, order-service, payment-service). Each service: REST/gRPC API, own DB, independent deploy. API Gateway: single entry (Kong, AWS API Gateway), routes to services. Service Discovery: register services (Consul, Eureka), clients discover dynamically. Circuit Breaker: prevent cascading failures (Hystrix), fallback on timeout. Saga: distributed transactions (orchestration or choreography). Sync: HTTP/gRPC for request-reply. Async: Kafka/RabbitMQ for events. Deploy: Docker + K8s, each service in pod. Benefits: scale independently, deploy fast. Challenges: distributed tracing, eventual consistency, network overhead.
common_patterns: API Gateway: Kong, AWS API Gateway, routes /users -> user-service
Service Discovery: Consul register/discover, Eureka client.register()
Database per service: user-service -> users_db, order-service -> orders_db
Sync communication: HTTP REST, gRPC for low latency
Saga orchestration: central coordinator manages steps
Saga choreography: services react to events independently
Docker + K8s: Dockerfile per service, Deployment YAML, Service for discovery
Distributed tracing: Jaeger, Zipkin track requests across services
